intro: Sida hamulosa, commonly known as the hookleaf sida, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes cotton and hibiscus. The plant is characterized by its narrow, lance-shaped leaves and small, pale yellow flowers. It typically grows as an annual or perennial herb, often found in disturbed soils and along roadsides. Sida hamulosa is known for its ability to thrive in poor soil conditions and is sometimes used in traditional medicine.
